Member Function Documentation

static create ( $  sName = null,
array $  arOptions = array() 
) [static]

Constructs and returns a jQuery Tools widget

The options passed in are dynamically added to the options array and will be accessible and modifiable as normal (.i.e. $this->theme, $this->baseUrl, etc.)

Parameters:
string $sName The type of jqTools widget to create
array $arOptions The options for the widget
string $sClass The class of the calling object if different
Returns:
CPSjqToolsWrapper

generateJavascript ( $  sClassName = null,
$  arOptions = null,
$  sInsertBeforeOptions = null 
) [protected]

Generates the javascript code for the widget

Returns:
string

Reimplemented from CPSjQueryWidget.

Definition at line 144 of file CPSjqToolsWrapper.php.

    {
        //  Fix up tabs...
        if ( null == $sInsertBeforeOptions && 'tabs' == $this->widgetName )
            $sInsertBeforeOptions = '"div.' . $this->paneClass . ' > div"';
            
        //  Expose widget is attached to target as a click event...
        switch ( $this->widgetName )
        {
            case 'expose':
                $_arOptions = ( null != $arOptions ) ? $arOptions : $this->makeOptions();
                $_sId = ( null != $sClassName ) ? '.' . $sClassName : ( ! $this->isEmpty( $this->target ) ) ? $this->target : '#' . $this->id;
                $_sScript = "$(\"{$_sId}\").click(function(){\$(this).expose({$_arOptions}).load();});";
                break;
            
            case 'flashembed':
                $_sSrc = $this->getOption( 'src', null );
                $_arOptions = $this->makeOptions();
                $_sScript = '$("' . $this->target . '").flashembed("' . $_sSrc . '", ' . $_arOptions . ');';
                break;
                
            default:
                $_sScript = parent::generateJavascript( $sClassName, $arOptions, $sInsertBeforeOptions );
                break;
        }
        
        return $this->script = $_sScript;
    }

    {
        parent::init();
    
        //  Set up support files array...
        $this->m_arSupportFiles = array(
            'tooltip' => array(
                'css' => array( 'tooltip.css' )
            ),
            'tabs' => array(
                'css' => array( 'tabs.css' )
            ),
            'scrollable' => array(
                'css' => array( 'scrollable.css' )
            ),
            'overlay' => array(
                'css' => array( 'overlay.css' )
            ),
        );

        //  Make sure we have the right stuff       
        if ( 'tabs' == $this->widgetName )
        {
            if ( ! $this->paneClass )
                throw new CException( Yii::t( 'yii', 'When creating "tabs" you must set the "paneClass" option to the class of the div containing the tab panes.' ) );
        }
    }

registerClientScripts ( $  bLocateScript = false  ) 

Registers the needed CSS and JavaScript.

Parameters:
boolean If true, system will try to find jquery plugins based on the pattern jquery.<plugin-name[.min].js
Returns:
CClientScript The current app's ClientScript object

        //  Daddy...
        parent::registerClientScripts( $bLocateScript );

const PS_EXTERNAL_PATH = '/jquery-tools'

The path where the assets for this widget are stored (underneath the psYiiExtensions/external base Currently, a CDN is in use and no local files are required...
